name: Avoid resource URL manipulation
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target method
description:
The application uses external input with reflection methods manipulating resources, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended behavior.

Using CAST data-flow engine, this metric detects paths from user input methods down to reflection code, paths which are open vulnerabilities to operating system injection flaws.
output:
List all methods that miss calling the required input validation calls

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from user input source down to the target method.
rationale:
The application uses external input with reflection methods manipulating resources, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended behavior.
This may enable an attacker to access or modify otherwise protected system resources.
reference:
CWE-99: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/99.html

Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) 
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2007

CISQ rule: ASCSM-CWE-99.
remediation:
Assume all input is malicious. 
Avoid using inputs. If it is not possible, use an "accept known good" input validation strategy, i.e., use stringent white-lists that limit the character set based on the expected value of the parameter in the request. This will indirectly limit the scope of an attack.
total: Number of methods calling user input methods
alternativeName: Ensure you have sanitized the methods manipulating resources
